REDCap Date-Time Conversion

redcap_import_datetime.Rd

This function prepares date-time values in a data table for import in REDCap. It parses date and time values and processes them using redcap_import_dates and redcap_import_times. This ensures that date-time entries, which may have been entered in various formats in Excel, are converted into a format compatible with REDCap.

Usage

redcap_import_datetime(
  var,
  args_rc_dates = list(),
  args_rc_times = list(),
  date_only = FALSE
)

Arguments

var

Variable to convert

args_rc_dates

List with arguments for redcap_import_dates (e.g. args_rc_dates = list(unk_day = 01,format = "american"))

args_rc_times

List with arguments for redcap_import_times (e.g. args_rc_times = list(unk_min = 01,unk_sec = 01))

date_only

If TRUE, only the date will be included in the output and the time value will be removed. Default = FALSE.

Value

converted variable

Examples

var <-c("1.2.24 11:11:00","1.2.22 11:11","1.2.24 11", "31341.34375")
redcap_import_datetime(var)
#> [1] "2024-02-01 11:11:00" "2022-02-01 11:11:00" "2024-02-01 11:00:00"
#> [4] "1985-10-21 08:15:00"
